newsitem.title: POLAND: POLISH NBP SELLS PLN 94 MLN BONDS AT OUTRIGHT.
newsitem.headline: POLISH NBP SELLS PLN 94 MLN BONDS AT OUTRIGHT.

text.p: The National Bank of Poland sold 83 million zlotys of 17-percent two-year fixed bonds, due July 12, 1997, after investors bid for 119 million of the bonds, the central bank said.
The NBP also sold 11 million zlotys of 14-percent five-year bonds, due July 12, 2000, after investors bid for 32 million of the paper.
The central bank offered 250 million zlotys of the shorter bonds and 100 million zlotys of the longer paper.
The minimum price of the two-year bonds was 99.19, up from 99.14 at Wednesday's outright and the average price was 99.22, up from 99.20.
The minimum price for the five-year paper was 90.04, up from 89.99 and the average price was 90.04, down from 90.09.
The settlement date is August 23, 1997 by 0900 local time.
